Legal_Issue: Whether a stay of removal should be granted based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Procedural_Stage: Pending judicial review of humanitarian and compassionate application
Evidence_Assessment: Emotional and financial support to nephews, successful business operations, establishment in Canada, potential hardship upon removal
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (Natoo) to demonstrate serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience
Credibility_Factor: Credible evidence of family ties and contributions to Canadian society
Legal_Rule: Tripartite test for stay: (1) serious issue, (2) irreparable harm, (3) balance of convenience
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness depending on context; here, court applied equitable principles
Procedural_Issue: Failure of removal officer to consider best interests of children and humanitarian factors
Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations under IRPA
Outcome_on_Merits: Not yet determined; pending judicial review
Review_Standard: Equitable discretion based on tripartite test
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Removal decision lacked procedural fairness due to failure to consider relevant factors
Key_Evidence_Considered: Support for nephews, business contributions, integration in Canada, impact of separation on children
Legal_Framework: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) provisions in IRPA, s. 25(1)
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging removal while H&C application is pending
Court_Result: Stay granted until judicial review is heard
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court Rules, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities with equitable considerations
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated; removal officer did not adequately address humanitarian factors
Evidence_Type: Affidavits, financial records, community involvement documentation
Remedy_Sought: Interim relief from removal pending final determination
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial intervention via application for stay

Authority: Federal Court jurisdiction under IRPA and Federal Courts Act

Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and compassionate application process with concurrent stay application
